get.description:
Lists User instances.

Admins can view and create new users.
Non-admin users can only view their own information.

post.description:
Lists User instances.

Admins can view and create new users.
Non-admin users can only view their own information.

get.description:
Retrieves a specific user.

Admins may view/modify/delete any user.

Non-admins may only view/modify/delete their own user instance.

parameters.name: user_uuid
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this user.

put.description:
Retrieves a specific user.

Admins may view/modify/delete any user.

Non-admins may only view/modify/delete their own user instance.

parameters.name: user_uuid
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this user.

patch.description:
Retrieves a specific user.

Admins may view/modify/delete any user.

Non-admins may only view/modify/delete their own user instance.

parameters.name: user_uuid
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this user.

delete.description:
Retrieves a specific user.

Admins may view/modify/delete any user.

Non-admins may only view/modify/delete their own user instance.

parameters.name: user_uuid
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this user.

get.description:
Lists available Workspace instances.

Admins can list all available Workspaces.

Non-admin users can only view their own Workspaces.

post.description:
Lists available Workspace instances.

Admins can list all available Workspaces.

Non-admin users can only view their own Workspaces.

get.description:
Retrieves a specific Workspace instance.

Admins may access any user's Workspace.

Non-admin users may only access their own Workspace instances.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this workspace.

put.description:
Retrieves a specific Workspace instance.

Admins may access any user's Workspace.

Non-admin users may only access their own Workspace instances.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this workspace.

patch.description:
Retrieves a specific Workspace instance.

Admins may access any user's Workspace.

Non-admin users may only access their own Workspace instances.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this workspace.

delete.description:
Retrieves a specific Workspace instance.

Admins may access any user's Workspace.

Non-admin users may only access their own Workspace instances.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this workspace.

get.description:
Lists available Resource instances.

Admins can list all available Resources.

Non-admin users can only view their own Resources.

post.description:
Lists available Resource instances.

Admins can list all available Resources.

Non-admin users can only view their own Resources.

get.description:
Retrieves a specific Resource instance.

Admins can get/modify any Resource.

Non-admin users can only view/edit their own Resources.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this resource.

put.description:
Retrieves a specific Resource instance.

Admins can get/modify any Resource.

Non-admin users can only view/edit their own Resources.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this resource.

patch.description:
Retrieves a specific Resource instance.

Admins can get/modify any Resource.

Non-admin users can only view/edit their own Resources.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this resource.

delete.description:
Retrieves a specific Resource instance.

Admins can get/modify any Resource.

Non-admin users can only view/edit their own Resources.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this resource.

get.description:
Returns a preview of the data underlying a Resource.

Typically used for checking that the parsing of a file worked
correctly and is formatted properly.

Depending on the data, the format of the response may be different.
Additionally, some Resource types do not support a preview.

Endpoint for checking the progress of an upload.

Requests must contain a "X-Progress-ID" header to identify
the upload they are monitoring.

Lists available Resource types.

Users can set their files to one of these types.

Typically used for populating selections.

Lists available Resource instances for a particular Workspace.

Admins can list all available Resources, but non-admin users 
can only view their own Resources.

post.description:
This endpoint allows a client to submit an email/password
and receive a JWT token (and refresh token)
Endpoint for refreshing the JWT auth token.
Used to register a new user by email/password

This validates the uid/token and activates the user once they click on
the link in their email

If a user's token expires, they exist in our system, but can't
activate.  This sends them another email with a new token

Used when a user has clicked on a reset link
and is sending a UID (encoded), a token, a new password,
and a re-typed confirmation of that password

Used when a user has forgotten password and
wants to reset.  Initiates the reset flow
including the sending of confirmation password.

This endpoint allows a client to exchange a google access token
for a WebMEV JWT token
Endpoint for a direct upload to the server.
This endpoint adds a Resource instance to a specific Workspace.
